ratings.comment: Took this course in the Fall 2019. Easily got 100 for all exams. It's true that the professor wasn't fully devoted to the course, but I don't understand why so many people complain about the difficulty.
Poor explainer, not enthusiatic about teaching.
Lectures are irrelevant to assignments, which are in turn irrelevant to exams. Ridiculous.

This is for Math 376. Shaoming appears to be an enthusiastic and knowledgeable instructor, but he cares little about his students. He comes to the lecture barely prepared and makes the simplest proof verbose and confusing. He rarely replies to emails. No exam review problems. Brutal class.
Really the worst in the math department. They shouldn't have let him teach.
Please save yourself. He just wants to wrap up the lecture and go home early. After the lectures everyone stood outside the door super confused and struggling to discuss the concepts.

Took calc 3 with Guo online. His lectures were confusing and he explained things poorly. Had to watch professor Leonard on Youtube to learn most tough concepts. Idk if he just struggles with the online format, but I would avoid him either way. Worst professor I've had so far in college.

Guo's lecturing ability is poor. He focuses on the theoretical proofs for unimportant aspects of a lesson and skips explaining the main subjects in a meaningful way, using very textbook type explanations that don't teach much. This makes even the simplest lessons confusing. If you are not able to learn everything on your own, avoid him.

When he lectures he reads off of the textbook and pretty much copies down exactly what was there without giving it an explanation. If he does give an explanation half of the time he uses terminology or notations that we never learned in Calc 1 or 2 so you can't understand it. If you're good at calc you'll survive but not happily.

Other than the fact that he doesn't really go over the lecture activities I can't understand some of the other criticism he receives. Tests are easy, hw is also easy and is 25% of your grade. 100% on both the online and written portions of the first test which I did in under 20 mins.

I don't really get the hate that this Guo receives. He's not the most energetic lecturer but he does a solid job applying what he teaches you and making sure that his lectures teach you to really understand what's going on, rather than just having you memorize steps for solving problems.

I got 10 points above average on the midterm and 10 points above average on my final and I GOT a B!!!! This is just ridiculous! He told us 35 percent will get A and 10 percent will get B but it seems like this is not true. BTW all my homework received full grade.

Professor Guo really know his stuff. His lectures are fast but really helpful. The proofs he provided are easy to understand than the ones from textbook. The grading criteria are clear, and he is DEFINITELY a easy grader. He gives out a lot out partial credits if you get the whole question wrong but ideas correctly.
Definitely the worst. Feels like he's trying hard to make students screw up their exams
Just don't take this course with him. Please! Save yourself!

This is my 4th math course in college, and Prof Guo is by far the worst prof I have had. His lectures consist of him facing the board and writing/speaking as fast as humanly possible, while never checking if the class is following. His assigned homework also does not follow what is expected to be learned of the course. Avoid this prof at all costs.
